conversations.content:
Hey there! I'm going to Paris on Monday and I was hoping you could help me find a restaurant that serves Chinese cuisine, is open on Mondays and has prices under 34 euros per person. Can you recommend me the restaurant with the best rating and reviews?
Tell me the restaurant name, rating, address, the price per person, and the operating hours.

<function_thought>
To find a suitable restaurant in Paris that serves Chinese cuisine, is open on Mondays, and has prices under 34 euros per person, I will start by gathering all restaurants in Paris, and then filter down to Chinese cuisine. This will allow me to gather further details including operating hours, pricing, ratings, and reviews. Following the function trajectory plan, the first step is to get all restaurants in Paris.
</function_thought>

<function_call>[get_all_restaurants_in_city(city="Paris")]</function_call>

<final_answer></final_answer>

Restaurant in Paris: New Israeli Restaurant
Breizh Café
New Asiaway
Le Baratin
Bistrot Paul Bert
Royal Panda
The yard
China Garden
Miznon
Chez L'Ami Jean

<function_thought>
Now that I have the list of restaurants in Paris, I will proceed to identify which of these offer Chinese cuisine. The next step is to get the cuisine type for these restaurants to filter out the Chinese ones.
</function_thought>

<function_call>[get_cuisine_type_for_restaurants(restaurant_names=["New Israeli Restaurant", "Breizh Café", "New Asiaway", "Le Baratin", "Bistrot Paul Bert", "Royal Panda", "The yard", "China Garden", "Miznon", "Chez L'Ami Jean"])]</function_call>

<function_thought>
